conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast by objects onto the ground, and their position and length depend on the angle and height of the light source.
When the light source moves forward, it changes the angle at which light rays hit the objects, resulting in changes in both the position and length of the shadows.
Shadows will shift in the opposite direction as the light source moves forward because the angle of incidence changes.
Shadows will move closer to the objects since the light rays become more perpendicular to the ground.
Shadows will generally become shorter as the light source moves closer to being directly overhead.
The angle of the light rays becomes more vertical, reducing the spread of the shadow.
Shadow A will move closer to the dress and become shorter.
Shadow B will move closer to the dragon and become shorter.
Shadow C will move closer to the mushrooms and become shorter.
Shadow D will move closer to the book and become shorter.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast based on the current position of the light source.
The light source shifts forward above the objects.
Shadows will shift backward, closer to the respective objects.
Shadows will shorten as the light rays become more vertical.
Shadow A moves closer to the dress and shortens.
Shadow B moves closer to the dragon and shortens.
Shadow C moves closer to the mushrooms and shortens.
Shadow D moves closer to the book and shortens.
When the light source moves forward, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift closer to their respective objects and become shorter.
